qas.question: Whose government did the guilds rebel against?
When did the guilds' rebellion take place?
What caused the nobility to leave Valencia?
From where did the anti-monarchists get inspiration?
What were the artisan guilds called?

context: Faced with this loss of business, Valencia suffered a severe economic crisis. This manifested early in <a1_0>1519–1523<a1_0/> when the artisan guilds known as <a4_0>the Germanies<a4_0/> revolted against the government of the Habsburg king <a0_0>Charles I<a0_0/> in Valencia, now part of the Crown of Aragon, with most of the fighting done in 1521. The revolt was an anti-monarchist, anti-feudal autonomist movement inspired by the <a3_0>Italian republics<a3_0/>, and a social revolt against the nobility who had fled the city before an epidemic of <a2_0>plague<a2_0/> in 1519. It also bore a strong anti-Islamic aspect, as rebels rioted against Aragon's population of mudéjars and imposed forced conversions to Christianity.
